intro: Byrsonima orientensis, commonly known as the Brazilian plum or murumuru butter tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are rich in oils and are used in traditional medicine and cosmetics. Its bark and leaves also contain compounds with potential medicinal properties.
